brewery.brewery_description:
The history of the "U Medvidku" building goes back to the beginnings of the 15th century. The house was named after one of its first owners, mr. Jan nedvídek, who founded the brewery in 1466 and manufactured beer until 1898.

Afterwards, the owners of the brewery houses could not compete with the newly-built industrial breweries; therefore, they closed their small breweries and founded the town brewery in Holešovice. Mr. Karel Vendulak, the last brewer, became the first director of the brewery. The brewery was rebuilt into one of the largest alehouses in Prague, featuring Prague's first tingl-tangl /cabaret/ at the beginning of the 20th century. In the nineteen-fifties, the premises was taken away from its owners, without any compensation, by a socialist government. The house deteriorated until 1989, and it wasn't until after its return to the inheritors of the original owners that the premises underwent vast reconstruction, during which the alehouse was extended and a stylish hotel was built.

The last stage of the reconstruction was completed in 2005, when the original malt house was rebuilt as the "house of beer" featuring a brewery store, congress hall and mini-brewery. The first brewing batch was symbolically finished on november 17, 2004, exactly 15 years after the "Velvet" revolution in the czech republic.

beer.beer_description:
Unfiltered 13° semi-dark lager, which is fermented and later undergoes secondary fermentation in oak barrels. This is why the beer is given the label Barrique.

Nefiltrovaný 13° polotmavý ležák, který kvasí a později dokváší v dubových sudech. Právě proto má pivo Oldgott přívlastek Barique.

items.checkin_comment: Caramely and toasty malt, a little hoppiness in the background but stays mostly smooth and slightly sweet

items.badge_description: Known for their pale lagers and pilsners, the Czech Republic has a long standing tradition of brewing. With the highest beer consumption per capita in the world, you’ll fit right in. That's 5 different beers from a brewery from the Czech Republic. Try 5 more for Level 2!

items.checkin_comment: Good welcome beer straight from the microbrewery in Prague

beer.beer_description:
Special brew with fresh hop.

12° světlý ležák chmelený za studena čerstvým žateckým chmelem. Někdy též vařen jako 13° speciál.

items.badge_description: It takes the perfect amount of light, the right framing and a touch of creative love to get the perfect picture of your brew. Now it’s time to drink it! That’s 50 check-ins with a photo. Take 5 more for Level 11!

There's beer in them thar hills! You're setting off on your journey through the world of beer, but be sure to take a little time to get to know each brewery as you go. That's a beer from 55 different breweries. Try 5 more for Level 12!

items.checkin_comment: This is the strongest beer in the world allegedly. I've had stronger, so presumably, it is in the malt only process. It is very sweet, nose of brown sugar. Smooth and sticky. Big strong finish. It's time for bed after this. 🤪

beer.beer_description:
The strongest beer in the world, semi-dark lager which is fermented in oak barrels for a period of 200 days.

Because we like challenges, we got the idea to try to brew the strongest beer in the Czech Republic. And in that way X-BEER, semi-dark special was born.

X-BEER is produced by traditional technology, using special procedures at different phases of production of beer. Used for the production is the Plzeň malt and caramel malt in the maximum quantity that we are still able to mash. How we achieve the high extract of the original hopped wort, will remain our secret, however, we may disclose that the high strength is achieved from barley malt only. The main fermentation proceeds in open oak fermentation tanks for 14 days. End fermentation proceeds in oak barrels for 14 weeks and then, after adding a special yeast strain, secondary fermentation proceeds for another 14 weeks.

items.checkin_comment: This is rich and smooth. You can smell the rum, and you can taste the rum. Beautifully balanced. Superb doppelbok.

beer.beer_description: Pivo k 20.výročí znovuotevření pivovaru. Silné tmavé pivo s rumovou příchutí. Dlouhé zrání s dřevěnými chipsy macerovanými v rumu Legendario. Dostupné také ve 200ks číslovaných lahví.

items.badge_description: Once you’ve had just one, there’s no doubt you’ll be saying "I'll be bock" for another. That's 35 different Bock beers. Try 5 more for Level 8! Want to learn more about this badge? Check out our podcast

Known for their pale lagers and pilsners, the Czech Republic has a long standing tradition of brewing. With the highest beer consumption per capita in the world, you’ll fit right in. That's 30 different beers from a brewery from the Czech Republic. Try 5 more for Level 7!

items.checkin_comment: Goes well with a pork knuckle 😋

beer.beer_description: Unfiltered 18° special beer with the flavour of Christmas.

items.checkin_comment: Caramel notes. Smooth mouthfeel. Balanced bitter finish.

items.badge_description: Wine isn't the only beverage worthy of pairing with a delicious meal. With so many styles widely available, there’s a perfect pint for any cuisine of your choosing. That's a beer at 65 different venues categorized as a Restaurant. Try 5 more for Level 14!

Everyone loves fresh beer, but obviously not as much as you do. You went straight to the source. 

That's a beer at 20 different venues categorized as a Brewery, Cidery or Meadery. Visit 5 more for Level 5!

user.bio: Néha ki kell engedni a gueuzet

items.badge_description: Traveling the world is hard, but not for you. It's as easy as cracking open a new brew! You have had a beer from at least 125 different regions around the world. Try 5 more for Level 26!

Fresh from the tap is one of the best ways to enjoy a beer. Just try to use a glass and not drink directly from the tap, as tempting as it may be. That's 385 checkins with the serving style of Draft. Try 5 more for Level 78!

items.checkin_comment: Sep 2006: geen finesse, geen balans, alleen suiker en alcohol die alle andere smaken killen.

beer.beer_description:
The strongest beer in the world, semi-dark lager which is fermented in oak barrels for a period of 200 days.

Because we like challenges, we got the idea to try to brew the strongest beer in the Czech Republic. And in that way X-BEER, semi-dark special was born.

X-BEER is produced by traditional technology, using special procedures at different phases of production of beer. Used for the production is the Plzeň malt and caramel malt in the maximum quantity that we are still able to mash. How we achieve the high extract of the original hopped wort, will remain our secret, however, we may disclose that the high strength is achieved from barley malt only. The main fermentation proceeds in open oak fermentation tanks for 14 days. End fermentation proceeds in oak barrels for 14 weeks and then, after adding a special yeast strain, secondary fermentation proceeds for another 14 weeks.

Unfiltered 13° semi-dark lager, which is fermented and later undergoes secondary fermentation in oak barrels. This is why the beer is given the label Barrique.

Nefiltrovaný 13° polotmavý ležák, který kvasí a později dokváší v dubových sudech. Právě proto má pivo Oldgott přívlastek Barique.

The strongest beer in the world, semi-dark lager which is fermented in oak barrels for a period of 200 days.

Because we like challenges, we got the idea to try to brew the strongest beer in the Czech Republic. And in that way X-BEER, semi-dark special was born.

X-BEER is produced by traditional technology, using special procedures at different phases of production of beer. Used for the production is the Plzeň malt and caramel malt in the maximum quantity that we are still able to mash. How we achieve the high extract of the original hopped wort, will remain our secret, however, we may disclose that the high strength is achieved from barley malt only. The main fermentation proceeds in open oak fermentation tanks for 14 days. End fermentation proceeds in oak barrels for 14 weeks and then, after adding a special yeast strain, secondary fermentation proceeds for another 14 weeks.

The name is derived from the founding of the brewery U Medvidku and also determines its gravity - 14.66°. Significant gravity is achieved double hopping.

Název je odvozen od roku založení pivovaru U medvídků a zároveň udává jeho stupňovitost - 14,66°. Výrazná stupňovitost je dosažena dvojím chmelením.

Special brew with fresh hop.

12° světlý ležák chmelený za studena čerstvým žateckým chmelem. Někdy též vařen jako 13° speciál.
Unfiltered 11° wheat beer, suitable for summer refreshment.

Unfiltered, 14° special dark beer with extra roast barley added.

Nefiltrovaný, 14° tmavý speciál s přidáním praženého ječmene.

Unfiltered, 12° wheat beer, brewed according to a mediaeval recipe.

Nefiltrované, 12° pšeničné pivo, uvařené podle středověkého receptu.

Unfiltered 16° beer, special dark beer with plum flavour.

Nefiltrované 16° pivo, ochucený tmavý speciál s příchutí švestek.
Unfiltered 18° special beer with the flavour of Christmas.

Unfiltered 15° special light beer with secondary fermentation in oak barrels.

Nefiltrovaný 15° světlý speciál dokvášený s medem v dubových sudech.

Unfiltered lovingly mysterious lager. Valentýn has a wonderful red colour, a pink head and a full honey-like flavour. This unfiltered lager was first available for tasting on 10 February 2010 and was very quick to find its fans amongst the ladies present and all beer connoisseurs – not just those in love.

Nefiltrovaný láskyplně tajemný ležák. Valentýn má krásnou červenou barvu, růžovou pěnu a plnou medovou chuť. Tento nefiltrovaný ležák byl poprvé k ochutnání 10. 2. 2010 a velmi rychle si našel své příznivce mezi přítomnými dámami i všemi - nejen zamilovanými znalci piva.

Vyrobeno z vody, ječného sladu, chmele a kotvičníku zemního. Dodává energii životní u mužnou, má mnoho pozitivních účinků. Mj. zvyšuje hladinu  testosteronu i FSH a nárůst libida. Doporučujeme podávat pravidelně v malých dávkách po odbu dvou měsíců.
Plum flavoured Dark lager
Warming up with this India Pale Ale is the perfect way to end a chilly day. Strong bitter taste and hop flavors are predominate in this unique beer style.
Speciální červený ležák s jemnou růžovou pěnou.
Craft Ale and Absinth herbs
Pivo k 20.výročí znovuotevření pivovaru. Silné tmavé pivo s rumovou příchutí. Dlouhé zrání s dřevěnými chipsy macerovanými v rumu Legendario. Dostupné také ve 200ks číslovaných lahví.

beer.beer_name: Black Beer by Black Light Theatre Metro
beer.beer_description:
Vyrobeno z vody, ječného sladu a chmele podle částečně dochované receptury pivovaru, který na tomto místě stával před 500 lety.

Made of water, barley malt and hop according to partially preserved prescription of the brewery that was at this place 500 years ago.
www.metrotheatre.cz
Semi-dark lager from micro-brewery.
18° tmavý svrchně kvašený speciál uvařený z 6 druhů sladu a britského chmele.
